New Records: Finn Allen hit 16 sixes in the third T20I against Pakistan, equaling a World Record.
Finn Allen posted the highest score by a Kiwi in men's T20I internationals with 137 runs, surpassing Brendon McCullum's 123.
Key Match Events: Finn Allen scored 137 runs from 62 balls, leading New Zealand to a total of 224/7.
New Zealand beat Pakistan by 45 runs in the third T20I.
Shaheen Afridi won the toss and elected to bowl, which may have been regretted as New Zealand raced to 67/1 in the Powerplay.
Haris Rauf claimed the early wicket of Devon Conway but conceded 60 runs in his spell.
Mohammad Wasim was the least expensive Pakistan bowler with figures of 1/35 from 4 overs.
New Zealand passed the 200 mark with an Allen six off the first ball of the 18th over.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand's total of 224/7 was achieved at the University Oval.
Suzie Bates' 124 against South Africa in 2020 remains New Zealand's best in Women's T20Is.
